title: Are Large Language Models Good Data Preprocessors?
author: Elyas Meguellati (The University of Queensland), Shazia Sadiq (The University of Queensland), Nardiena Pratama (The University of Queensland), Gianluca Demartini (The University of Queensland), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores the application of Large Language Models (LLMs) in data preprocessing, which could provide insights into automated audio dataset preparation or previous studies related to speech generation tasks.
background: The study investigates the effectiveness of Large Language Models in cleaning and refining text from image captions generated by AI models to improve downstream tasks like persuasion detection.
contribution: This paper introduces a comparison of various Large Language Models for the task of cleaning generated captions, achieving insights into their relative performance and utility in data preprocessing.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods mainly rely on rule-based systems for cleaning text from AI outputs, which often struggle with the complexities of generated data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages multiple LLMs, assessing their varying capabilities in processing and refining noisy textual data for specific downstream tasks.

key_innovation: The application of multiple LLMs for data cleaning tasks in multimodal contexts, particularly in the challenging domain of persuasion detection in memes.
real_world_impact: Improving the quality of training data for downstream tasks could significantly enhance the performance of models in real-world applications, such as social media analysis and content moderation.
limitations: Statistical tests reveal that the improvements achieved through LLM cleaning may not be significant, suggesting the challenges of relying on LLMs for effective data preprocessing.

new_terms.multilabel persuasion detection: **Multilabel persuasion detection** refers to the task of identifying multiple persuasive techniques used in memes, as they can employ diverse methods to influence viewers.
new_terms.LLMs: **Large Language Models** are sophisticated AI systems designed to understand and generate human-like text based on the context and prompts provided.
